full_text: Screened by NARA, 922/2023 THE I DE RADIOLOGY GROUP, P.C. Francis M. Kelley, M.D. Frederick S. Erdman, M.D. Laurence W. Betts, M.D. July 19, 1989 #F135631 Ronald L. Hainen, M.D. Michael E. Lebowitz, M.D. W. Winslow Schrank, M.D. Derace L. Schaffer, M.D. Alessandro Bertoni, M.D. Richard E. Tobin, M.D. 2211 Lyell Avenue Herman A. Wallinga, M.D. Rochester, New York 14606 Steven G. Herbert, M.D. John D. Kennedy, M.D. Dear Dr. Bertoni: George W. Parker, M.D. David J. Millet, M.D. The following is the report on MEHTA SAT PARKASH RAI CHHIBBER, Bruce J. Thaler, M.D. who was seen in our Westfall Park office 7/19/89. Nancy A. Gadziala, M.D. IMMIGRATION CHEST: John T. Hurley, M.D. Walter M. Plassche, M.D. There is mild cardiac enlargement. Calcium is seen in the aortic Jeffrey J. Benjamin, M.D. wall with mild unfolding of that structure. Moderate apical Rosemary Utz, M.D. thickening is noted bilaterally with a little greater involvement Ted D. Barnett, M.D. on the right. The lungs are clear of active disease. The Victor Regenbogen, M.D. costophrenic angles are sharp. There is a healed right sixth Robert F. Spataro, M.D. rib fracture. There is mild scoliosis. The soft tissues are unremarkable. IMPRESSION: Mild cardiac enlargement and bilateral apical thickening. No definite acute disease process. Thank you for the opportunity of seeing this patient.
